67 typedef enum atcacert_cert_sn_src_e
68 {
69  SNSRC_STORED = 0x0,
70  SNSRC_STORED_DYNAMIC = 0x7,
71  SNSRC_DEVICE_SN = 0x8,
72  SNSRC_SIGNER_ID = 0x9,
73  SNSRC_PUB_KEY_HASH = 0xA,
74  SNSRC_DEVICE_SN_HASH = 0xB,
75  SNSRC_PUB_KEY_HASH_POS = 0xC,
76  SNSRC_DEVICE_SN_HASH_POS = 0xD,
77  SNSRC_PUB_KEY_HASH_RAW = 0xE,
78  SNSRC_DEVICE_SN_HASH_RAW = 0xF
79 } atcacert_cert_sn_src_t;

SNSRC_DEVICE_SN_HASH_POS
Depreciated, don&#39;t use. Cert serial number is the SHA256(Device SN + Encoded dates), with MSBit set to 0 to ensure it&#39;s positive. Only applies to device certificates.
